metadata.name: Safe and Sound
metadata.description: This photograph captures the magnificent eastern horizon from the picturesque island of Siargao, situated amongst the easternmost islands of the Philippines. Beyond this small island lies the vast expanse of the Pacific Ocean. Three men are depicted standing precariously close to the edge of existence. The sea is known for its unpredictable nature and hostile conditions, yet the three individuals remain eerily calm in this treacherous setting. Upon closer inspection, we realize that there are numerous situations that evoke fear due to their potential for rapid and deadly change. However, this image serves as a powerful reminder that we have the choice to embrace either trust or fear. Trust is not the absence of fear, but rather fear seems to be the trust in a negative outcome. By adopting this mentality, we can cultivate trust in life, even when negative outcomes are a possibility. This allows us to make conscious choices about where to place our trust in any given circumstance.
